intro: Phlogacanthus insignis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, branched stem. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, and it thrives in humid, well-drained soil. Phlogacanthus insignis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
